title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: A classic novel about racial injustice and moral growth in the Deep South.

author: George Orwell
description: A chilling vision of a totalitarian future where Big Brother watches everyone.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
description: A witty and romantic novel about love, class, and social expectations in 19th-century England.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: A tragic story of wealth, love, and the American Dream in the Roaring Twenties.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
description: An epic tale of obsession and revenge on the high seas.

title: War and Peace
author: Leo Tolstoy
description: A sweeping saga of Russian society during the Napoleonic Wars.

title: Crime and Punishment
author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
description: A gripping novel about guilt, redemption, and the human psyche.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
description: A rebellious teenager's journey through New York City, exploring themes of identity and isolation.

title: Brave New World
author: Aldous Huxley
description: A dystopian world where happiness is engineered and individuality is suppressed.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: The adventurous journey of Bilbo Baggins, a hobbit caught in an epic quest.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
description: An epic tale of good versus evil in Middle-earth.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer’s Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
description: A young boy discovers he is a wizard and attends Hogwarts School of Witchcraft and Wizardry.

title: The Alchemist
author: Paulo Coelho
description: A young shepherd embarks on a journey to discover his personal legend.

title: One Hundred Years of Solitude
author: Gabriel García Márquez
description: A multi-generational saga of the Buendía family in the mythical town of Macondo.

title: The Book Thief
author: Markus Zusak
description: A moving story about a girl in Nazi Germany who finds solace in stolen books.

title: The Road
author: Cormac McCarthy
description: A father and son journey through a desolate, ruined world.

title: The Kite Runner
author: Khaled Hosseini
description: A powerful story of friendship, betrayal, and redemption set in Afghanistan.

title: Sapiens: A Brief History of Humankind
author: Yuval Noah Harari
description: An exploration of the history and impact of Homo sapiens on the world.

title: Meditations
author: Marcus Aurelius
description: Reflections on life and Stoic wisdom from a Roman emperor.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: A guide to building good habits and breaking bad ones through small changes.
